required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Combination of BI6727 (Volasertib) and BIBF1120 in Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label Phase I Dose Escalation Trial of Intravenous BI 6727 in Combination With Oral BIBF 1120 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumours With Repeated Administration in Patients With Clinical Benefit

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of the current study is to investigate the Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) in terms of safety and tolerability of BI 6727 in combination with fixed dose BIBF 1120, in patients with advanced or metastatic solid tumours.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLTs) in the First Cycle for the Determination of the Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD).
primary_outcome.description: DLT was defined as: Drug-related CTCAE (Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events) grade 3 or 4 non-haematological toxicity (except untreated vomiting, untreated nausea, or untreated diarrhoea) or Drug-related CTCAE grade 4 neutropenia for 7 or more days and/or complicated by infection or CTCAE grade 4 thrombocytopenia

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of Volasertib in Combination With Nintedanib
primary_outcome.description: The MTD was determined using a 3+3 design with de-escalation. The MTD was defined as the highest dose level at which maximal 1 out of 6 patients experienced DLT in the first course of the escalation nd de-escalation phase. However, all DLT's occurring in the trial were considered for selection of the recommended dose for further development.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Drug Related Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first study drug administration until 28 days after the last administration of any study medication, up to 485 days
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with investigator-defined drug related adverse events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Dose Limiting Toxicities
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first study drug administration until 28 days after the last administration of any study medication, up to 485 days
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with dose limiting toxicities (DLTs). DLT was defined as: Drug-related CTCAE grade 3 or 4 non-haematological toxicity (except untreated vomiting, untreated nausea, or untreated diarrhoea) or Drug-related CTCAE grade 4 neutropenia for 7 or more days and/or complicated by infection or CTCAE grade 4 thrombocytopenia

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0:05 h before start of Volasertib infusion and 1:00, 2:00, 3:00, 4:00, 8:00 and 24 h after start of Volasertib infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum measured concentration (Cmax) in plasma of Volasertib in Cycle 1.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0:05 h before start of Volasertib infusion and 1:00, 2:00, 3:00, 4:00, 8:00 and 24 h after start of Volasertib infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Total plasma Clearance (CL) of Volasertib in Cycle 1.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0:05 h before start of Volasertib infusion and 1:00, 2:00, 3:00, 4:00, 8:00 and 24 h after start of Volasertib infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Volume of distribution at steady state (Vss) of Volasertib in Cycle 1.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 min before Nintedanib administration in the morning and 1:00, 2:00, 3:00, 4:00, 6:00 h after administration on Day 9
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum measured concentration (Cmax) of Nintedanib in Cycle 1. 400 mg Volasertib + 200 mg Nintedanib group is not displayed due to data only being available for one patient.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 min before Nintedanib administration in the morning and 1:00, 2:00, 3:00, 4:00, 6:00 h after administration on Day 9
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve (AUC) of Nintedanib over the time interval 0 to 6 hours in Cycle 1. 400 mg Volasertib + 200 mg Nintedanib group is not displayed due to data only being available for one patient.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 min before Nintedanib administration in the morning and 1:00, 2:00, 3:00, 4:00, 6:00 h after administration on Day 9
secondary_outcome.description: Time from dosing to the maximum measured concentration, Cmax, of Nintedanib (tmax) in Cycle 1. 400 mg Volasertib + 200 mg Nintedanib group is not displayed due to data only being available for one patient.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Best Overall Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessment was performed at screening and every 2nd course until earliest time of progression, death or end of treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Best overall response based on response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. Best overall response is defined as the best overall response (complete response, partial response, stable disease, progressive disease or not evaluable) since the start of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Objective Response (OR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessment was performed at screening and every 2nd course until earliest time of progression, death or end of treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Objective tumor response based on response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. OR is defined as complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) as best response throughout the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Disease Control
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessment was performed at screening and every 2nd course until earliest time of progression, death or end of treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Disease control based on response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. Disease control is defined as complete response (CR), partial response (PR) or stable disease (SD) as best response throughout the study.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessment was performed at screening and every 2nd course until earliest time of progression, death or end of treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Disease control based on response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. Patients who had a best overall tumour response of complete response (CR), partial response (PR) or stable disease (SD) were assessed to show disease control.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessment was performed at screening and every 2nd course until earliest time of progression, death or end of treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the time from start of treatment with study medication to tumour progression or death whichever occurs first. Tumour response was to be documented using appropriate techniques such as magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) or computer tomography (CT).

arm_group.description: Finding Maximum Tolerated Dose of BI 6727 in combination with BIBF 1120

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Patients with confirmed diagnosis of advanced, non resectable and/or metastatic solid tumours, who have failed conventional treatment, and for whom no therapy of proven efficacy exists, or who are not amenable to established forms of treatment
2. Age > or = 18 years
3. European Cooperative Oncology Group performance status < or = 2
4. Written informed consent in accordance with International Conference on Harmonization -Good Clinical Practice (ICH-GCP) and local legislation
5. Recovery from Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events grade 2-4 therapy-related toxicities from previous systemic anti-cancer therapies or radiotherapy (except alopecia)
Exclusion criteria:
1. Serious illness or concomitant non-oncological disease considered by the investigator to be incompatible with the trial
2. Known hypersensitivity to the trial drugs or their excipients
3. Treatment with any other investigational drug or participation in any other interventional trial within 28 days before first administration of trial drug (BIBF 1120) or concomitantly with this trial
4. Systemic anti-cancer therapy or radiotherapy within 28 days before start of therapy or concomitantly with this trial. The restriction does not apply to steroids and bisphosphonates
5. Active infectious disease infection or HIV I/II
6. Other malignancy currently requiring another anti-cancer therapy
7. Clinical evidence of symptomatic progressive brain or leptomeningeal disease during the past 6 months
8. Known inherited predisposition to bleeding or thrombosis
9. Radiographic evidence of cavitary or necrotic tumours
10. History of clinically significant haemoptysis within the past 3 months
11. Centrally located tumours with radiographic evidence (Computed Tomography or Magnetic Resonance Imaging) of local invasion of major blood vessels
12. Absolute Neutrophil Count (ANC) less than 1.5 x 1000000000/L
13. Platelets Count (PLT) less than 100 x 1000000000/L
14. Total bilirubin > upper limit of normal (ULN)
15. Alaninaminotransferase (ALT) and/or Aspartateaminotransferase (AST) >= 1.5 x ULN (in case of liver metastases: ALT and AST >= 2.5 x ULN)
16. Serum creatinine > 1.5 mg/dl
17. Major injuries and/or surgery or bone fracture within 28 days before first administration of trial drug (BIBF 1120), or planned surgical procedures during the trial period
18. Known history of clinically relevant QT prolongation (e.g. long QT syndrome)
19. History of severe haemorrhagic or thromboembolic event in the past 6 months (excluding central venous catheter thrombosis and peripheral deep vein thrombosis)
20. Therapeutic anticoagulation (except low dose heparin and/or heparin flush as needed for maintenance of an indwelling intravenous device) or antiplatelet therapy (except for chronic low-dose therapy with acetylsalicylic acid < or = 325mg per day)
21. Active alcohol or drug abuse
22. Women and men who are sexually active and unwilling to use a medically acceptable method of contraception during the trial
23. Pregnancy or breast-feeding
24. Patients unable to comply with the protocol
25. Uncontrolled hypertension

participant_flow.recruitment_details: An uncontrolled, open-label, dose escalation study in cohorts of patients following the ‘3+3 design with de-escalation’. After entering the study, cohorts of patients were sequentially allocated to the dose levels.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Beginning after the first cycle of treatment, intra-patient dose escalations were allowed and could be repeated after every cycle. Intra-patient dose escalation was not allowed after the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) was determined.

group.title: 100 mg Volasertib + 200 mg Nintedanib
group.description: Course 1 comprised of 28 days because of a 7-day run-in period for nintedanib (200 mg twice daily). The treatment with nintedanib started on Day 1 of Course 1 and continued until the end of the course. 100 mg volasertib was infused on Day 8 of Course 1; no nintedanib was to be taken on that day. Course 2 and subsequent courses comprised 21 days. Volasertib was infused on Day 1 and continuous nintedanib administration re-started on Day 2.

group.description: Course 1 comprised of 28 days because of a 7-day run-in period for nintedanib (200 mg twice daily). The treatment with nintedanib started on Day 1 of Course 1 and continued until the end of the course. 400 mg volasertib was infused on Day 8 of Course 1; no nintedanib was to be taken on that day.

measure.title: CL of Volasertib
measure.description: Total plasma Clearance (CL) of Volasertib in Cycle 1.

outcome.title: Vss of Volasertib
outcome.description: Volume of distribution at steady state (Vss) of Volasertib in Cycle 1.
outcome.time_frame: 0:05 h before start of Volasertib infusion and 1:00, 2:00, 3:00, 4:00, 8:00 and 24 h after start of Volasertib infusion

group.title: 100 mg Volasertib + 200 mg Nintedanib
group.description: Course 1 comprised of 28 days because of a 7-day run-in period for nintedanib (200 mg twice daily). The treatment with nintedanib started on Day 1 of Course 1 and continued until the end of the course. 100 mg volasertib was infused on Day 8 of Course 1; no nintedanib was to be taken on that day. Course 2 and subsequent courses comprised 21 days. Volasertib was infused on Day 1 and continuous nintedanib administration re-started on Day 2.

group.description: Course 1 comprised of 28 days because of a 7-day run-in period for nintedanib (200 mg twice daily). measure.title: Vss of Volasertib
measure.description: Volume of distribution at steady state (Vss) of Volasertib in Cycle 1.

outcome.title: Cmax of Nintedanib
outcome.description: Maximum measured concentration (Cmax) of Nintedanib in Cycle 1. 400 mg Volasertib + 200 mg Nintedanib group is not displayed due to data only being available for one patient.
outcome.time_frame: 5 min before Nintedanib administration in the morning and 1:00, 2:00, 3:00, 4:00, 6:00 h after administration on Day 9

measure.title: Tmax of Nintedanib

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Best Overall Response
outcome.description: Best overall response based on response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. Best overall response is defined as the best overall response (complete response, partial response, stable disease, progressive disease or not evaluable) since the start of treatment.
outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessment was performed at screening and every 2nd course until earliest time of progression, death or end of treatment.

measure.title: Number of Patients With Best Overall Response
measure.description: Best overall response based on response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. Best overall response is defined as the best overall response (complete response, partial response, stable disease, progressive disease or not evaluable) since the start of treatment.

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Objective Response (OR)
outcome.description: Objective tumor response based on response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. OR is defined as complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) as best response throughout the study.
outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessment was performed at screening and every 2nd course until earliest time of progression, death or end of treatment.

group.title: 100 mg Volasertib + 200 mg Nintedanib
group.description: Course 1 comprised of 28 days because of a 7-day run-in period for nintedanib (200 mg twice daily). measure.title: Number of Patients With Objective Response (OR)
measure.description: Objective tumor response based on response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. OR is defined as complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) as best response throughout the study.

outcome.title: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of Volasertib in Combination With Nintedanib
outcome.description: The MTD was determined using a 3+3 design with de-escalation. The MTD was defined as the highest dose level at which maximal 1 out of 6 patients experienced DLT in the first course of the escalation nd de-escalation phase. However, all DLT's occurring in the trial were considered for selection of the recommended dose for further development.
outcome.population: Treated Set. All patients who received >= 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: Volasertib in Combination With Nintedanib
group.description: All patients received both Volasertib and Nintedanib. Starting dose of Volasertib was 100 mg, the next dose levels were 200 mg, 300 mg, 350 mg and 400 mg, which was to be infused on Day 8 in Course 1 and on Day 1 of subsequent courses. 200 mg Nintedanib was continuously administered twice daily except for the day of Volasertib administration.

measure.title: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of Volasertib in Combination With Nintedanib
measure.description: The MTD was determined using a 3+3 design with de-escalation. The MTD was defined as the highest dose level at which maximal 1 out of 6 patients experienced DLT in the first course of the escalation nd de-escalation phase. However, all DLT's occurring in the trial were considered for selection of the recommended dose for further development.
measure.population: Treated Set. All patients who received >= 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Disease Control
outcome.description: Disease control based on response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. Disease control is defined as complete response (CR), partial response (PR) or stable disease (SD) as best response throughout the study.
outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessment was performed at screening and every 2nd course until earliest time of progression, death or end of treatment.

Course 2 and subsequent courses comprised 21 days. Volasertib was infused on Day 1 and continuous nintedanib administration re-started on Day 2.

measure.title: Number of Patients With Disease Control
measure.description: Disease control based on response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. Disease control is defined as complete response (CR), partial response (PR) or stable disease (SD) as best response throughout the study.

outcome.title: Duration of Disease Control
outcome.description: Disease control based on response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. Patients who had a best overall tumour response of complete response (CR), partial response (PR) or stable disease (SD) were assessed to show disease control.
outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessment was performed at screening and every 2nd course until earliest time of progression, death or end of treatment.
outcome.population: All patients of the treated set that were assessed to show disease control.

group.title: 100 mg Volasertib + 200 mg Nintedanib
group.description: Course 1 comprised of 28 days because of a 7-day run-in period for nintedanib (200 mg twice daily). The treatment with nintedanib started on Day 1 of Course 1 and continued until the end of the course. 100 mg volasertib was infused on Day 8 of Course 1; no nintedanib was to be taken on that day. Course 2 and subsequent courses comprised 21 days. Volasertib was infused on Day 1 and continuous nintedanib administration re-started on Day 2.

group.description: Course 1 comprised of 28 days because of a 7-day run-in period for nintedanib (200 mg twice daily). The treatment with nintedanib started on Day 1 of Course 1 and continued until the end of the course. 400 mg volasertib was infused on Day 8 of Course 1; no nintedanib was to be taken on that day.

group.title: Total Patients
group.description: All patients received both Volasertib and Nintedanib. Volasertib was to be infused on Day 8 in Course 1 and on Day 1 of subsequent courses, dose level varied between 100mg and 400mg. 200 mg Nintedanib was continuously administered twice daily except for the day of Volasertib administration.

measure.title: Duration of Disease Control
measure.description: Disease control based on response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. Patients who had a best overall tumour response of complete response (CR), partial response (PR) or stable disease (SD) were assessed to show disease control.
measure.population: All patients of the treated set that were assessed to show disease control.

outcome.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: PFS is defined as the time from start of treatment with study medication to tumour progression or death whichever occurs first. Tumour response was to be documented using appropriate techniques such as magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) or computer tomography (CT).
outcome.time_frame: Tumor assessment was performed at screening and every 2nd course until earliest time of progression, death or end of treatment.

group.description: All patients received both Volasertib and Nintedanib. Volasertib was to be infused on Day 8 in Course 1 and on Day 1 of subsequent courses, dose level varied between 100mg and 400mg. 200 mg Nintedanib was continuously administered twice daily except for the day of Volasertib administration.

measure.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: PFS is defined as the time from start of treatment with study medication to tumour progression or death whichever occurs first. Tumour response was to be documented using appropriate techniques such as magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) or computer tomography (CT).

reported_events.time_frame: All adverse events (AEs) that occurred during therapy with the study medication, or within 28 days after the last administration of any study medication, up to 485 days
reported_events.desc: Patients were asked for spontaneous reports about AEs; detailed information was collected by specific questions.

group.title: 200 mg Volasertib + 200 mg Nintedanib
group.description: Course 1 comprised of 28 days because of a 7-day run-in period for nintedanib (200 mg twice daily). The treatment with nintedanib started on Day 1 of Course 1 and continued until the end of the course. 200 mg volasertib was infused on Day 8 of Course 1; no nintedanib was to be taken on that day. Course 2 and subsequent courses comprised 21 days. Volasertib was infused on Day 1 and continuous nintedanib administration re-started on Day 2.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Boehringer Ingelheim (BI) acknowledges that investigators have the right to publish the study results. Investigators shall provide BI with a copy of any publication or presentation for review prior to any submission. Such review will be done with regard to proprietary information, information related to patentable inventions, medical, scientific, and statistical accuracy within 60 days. BI may request a delay of the publication in order to protect BI’s intellectual property rights.
